name: maize grain production, rainfed | maize grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20914/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of grain maize (fresh matter). The yield is 3770 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 13%.;;;Modelling is based on three different grain maize varieties, one GM-free and two GM varieties (Bazillus thuringiensis (GM-Bt) and Roundup Ready (GM-RR)), each accounting for the following proportion of total production:  ;GM-free:16.3% ;GM-Bt: 59.8% ;GM-RR: 24.0%;;Mineral N-P2O5-K2O fertiliser input is 66-11-7  kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 2.5  t/ha of solid manure. "

This activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop. 

This activity ends with the transport of the harvested crop to the farm. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers, and pesticides are considered. Manure is the only organic fertiliser applied. The dataset includes all machine operations: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, combine-harvesting, transport of the harvested maize from the field to farm (5 km). Direct field emissions are also included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled based on data from South Africa.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography South Africa. The planning models used as data sources apply to cultivation in three maize production regions in South Africa: the Eastern Highveld, North West, and Central and Northern Free State. These data are assumed to be representative for all South African grain maize production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Production data are from Grain SA planning models and maize production reports and from the Griekwaland Wes Korporatief (GWK) cost guide (Grain SA Operational planning of white maize grain production in the production year 2011/2012 in Eastern Highveld, South Africa; Lynnwood Ridge, South Africa, 2014; Grain SA Operational planning of white maize grain production in the production year 2011/2012 in Northwest, South Africa; Lynnwood Ridge, South Africa, 2014; Grain SA Operational planning of white maize grain production in the production year 2011/2012 in Central and Northern Free State, South Africa; Lynnwood Ridge, South Africa, 2014; Grain SA Maize production in South Africa from 2006-2013; Lynnwood Ridge, South Africa, 2014;  Rechtus, S. GWK cost guide data 2016). Transport distances were obtained from J. Coetzee, an extension officer for South African Breweries Ltd., as well as by using online distance calculators for land ( DistanceFromTo Available online: http://www.distancefromto.net (accessed on Apr 15, 2015)) and sea (SeaRates.com Available online: http://www.searates.com/de/reference/portdistance (accessed on Apr 15, 2015).) routes.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'maize grain' is calculated to be circa 2.58E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.16E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), P content in topsoil according to Nemecek, Kägi T. & Blaser S. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'atrazine', 'cyclic N-compound', 'glyphosate', 'metolachlor', 'nitrile-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'phenoxy-compound', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.08E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
